text: Ever since Disneyland first opened the Pirates of the Caribbean ride in 1967, the attraction has become blockbuster movie franchise and a must - see for all who enter the gates of any of the Disney parks around the world. However, there has been one part of the ride that has remained controversial : the bride auction scene. What may have been okay in the ’ 60s is now a bit insensitive and — let ’ s be honest — very misogynistic. Now that Disney has become aware of this, the scene that once had a redheaded character named Redd as part of a “ wench sale ” with signs that read “ Auction take a wench for a bride ” has changed with the times.
